revised_title: Thermo-Electricity and Its Effects on Conductors
tldr: The author investigates the thermal effects of electric currents in unequally heated conductors, specifically copper and iron, and discovers that the convection of heat is carried by vitreous and resinous electricity in these metals. This research helps establish the third hypothesis, which states that vitreous electricity carries heat in an unequally heated copper conductor, and resinous electricity carries heat in an unequally heated iron conductor.
